sections.name: Decision Making
sections.description: Looks at your ability to apply logic to reach a decision or conclusion, evaluate arguments and analyse statistical information.

stems.text: All countries provide Visas to the passport holders of country X; country B provides Visas to the passport holders of only two countries; country A provides Visas to the passport holders of country B and vice versa.

questions.text: Place 'Yes' if the conclusion does follow. Place 'No' if the conclusion does not follow.
options: All diplomatic passport holders receive Visas in country B.
A man received a Visa in country C so he must have a passport of country X.
Country B passport holders are eligible for Visas in country X.
Passport holders of country X never have to worry about applying for a Visa in advance.
Samantha received a Visa in country B so she must have a passport of either country X or country A.
questions.explanation: Passport holders must always be in Country B regardless of circumstance.

stems.text:
There are eight apartments on a floor; each apartment has either one, two, three or four rooms, as shown in the figure. Each apartment is owned by one of four owners: Adam, Flora, Gary or Rose. Each owner owns two apartments.

Both of Adam's apartments are in the same horizontal row but do not share a wall.
Either Rose or Flora, have the same number of rooms in their two apartments.
Gary's two apartments share one dividing wall and neither Gary nor Flora have a 3-room apartment.

questions.text: The 1-room apartments belong to whch of the following owners?
questions.explanation: Gary also owns the 1 room apartments. Is that even a question?
